text: [MUSIC PLAYING]

Two big corporations
like Amazon and Telefónica

still have the opportunity
of focusing on small things
that can be great.
I'm Chema Alonso

and the Chief Digital Officer
of Telefónica.

I've been working
for this company for 10 years.
And I'm responsible for innovation,

for digital products,
the platforms, data, etc.

So, I'm more than happy to be here
and talk about what we do together.

Can you tell us a little bit more
what was the strategic opportunity

that Telefónica saw
and how that evolved?

The truth is
that it was a wonderful project

in a very specific moment,
just before the pandemic.

Telefónica is, in most
of the countries in which we operate,

we are the first technology provider
for customers at their homes,

so we have a lot of technology
in our customers' houses.
We have video, we have Wi-Fi,

we have phone,
we have IoT systems, etc.

But we saw that people were trying
to have more experiences at home
and we had the platform,

but we needed
to innovate in different ways.
So, we saw that as a good opportunity

for the customers to bring
that wonderful technology

of Amazon E-Commerce into the TV
through their Living Apps,

which is a strategy
in which we want to expand

and open up the ecosystem
that we have at home
for third-party providers.

And, of course,
Amazon was the perfect solution

to bring TV commerce
to our customer houses.

And we did it.
It was the beginning of the idea.
Can you tell me a little bit,

how unique was
to work with AWS and Amazon?

What was different
and which methodology and approaches
we actually used together?

Our customer focus,
customer obsession is very similar.

I remember that
when we started to work

in the idea of bringing
Amazon E-Commerce into TV,

we needed to define
a new architecture.

We created something...
an e-commerce with 20,000 products
with four stars to our customers.

We realized
how important small details are
in the experience for our customers.

And, of course, made the difference
in Amazon to success in the market.

I used to say to my team that
the most wonderful is that,

two big corporations
like Amazon and Telefónica

still have the opportunity
of focusing on small things
that can be great later.

So, what are your customers
experiencing now with the Living App
and how is it benefiting their life?

Seeing a lot of products
in a living room environment
with more family members,

looking together for something
that they need at home,
having that discussion allows them

to take the final decision
at the right moment.

It transforms the way
they were buying things
into sharing an experience.
And we have great executives

that are listening
to your experience,

what are some of the suggestions
that you feel like sharing with them?
You need to start small,

and continue working
and continue growing.
Don't look for the best solution

because you are going to need
to do changes continuously.
Listen to the customers.

So, it's a continuous
process of learning.

It's a continuous process
of refining the product.
Even if you are a big corporation,

you need to put focus
in small projects
that could be big in the future.

-Well, Chema, thanks a lot.
-Thanks to you-
And it's a huge pleasure.
[MUSIC PLAYING]
